Suggest appointment of a dedicated Parliamentary counsel for constitutional advice in order to improve legislative deliberation #nlrc2016
Parliamentarians ought to be provided with full and thorough constitutional advice in order to meet obligations- @Gabrielle_J_A #NLRC2016
Debeljek: the Vic HR Charter requires dialogue between the arms of government in balancing protections and democracy #NLRC2016
Birth registration is a prerequisite to legal personhood. This often doesn't recognize Indigenous traditional practices @MsCastan #nlrc2016
Unregistered births impact mostly on indigenous and CALD communities. Entrenching vulnerability and marginalization @MsCastan #NLRC2016
Australians without a birth certificate are disenfranchised from most aspects of citizenship and civil life- @MsCastan #NLRC2016
Davies: understood from the bottom up, law is everywhere and had an oppressive weight #NLRC2016
Davies: law is not neutral to social order, but replicates and shapes social norms #NLRC2016
Davies: There is a view that law operates to protect privilege #NLRC2016
Hopkins: equality before the law requires due allowance+respect for relevant difference- law must engage w differences b/w people #NLRC2016
Hopkins: Indigenous youth suicide was 80% of total Australian suicide in 2010 #NLRC2016
Hopkins asks us to consider searching for genuine equality in criminal justice in Aus, with 50% of juvenile detainees ATSI youth #NLRC2016
Bartels: >6% of ATSI men in WA are in prison at any time- the most imprisoned group of people on the world. A true crisis #NLRC2016
We need to consider the impact of all policy decisions on pushing up imprisonment rates- be it sentencing or housing #NLRC2016
Bartels challenges Australia to curb our prison addiction #NLRC2016
Context evidence is crucial for a jury to comprehend a victim's version of events, but it may unfairly characterize a defendant #nlrc2016
Anderson on the fraught issue of tendency and context evidence in sexual assault cases #NLRC2016
Interesting to hear how the Govt/Opposition composed PJCIS has sidelined the more independent Senate oversight committee #nlrc2016
Great consideration of scrutiny and parliamentary oversight by committees in Dominque Dalla-Pozza's presentation #nlrc2016
Kirby delivers an eloquent, vivid masterclass on the history of institutional law reform in aus + wider world #nlrc2016
Incredible moving reading of Yeats by Michael Kirby in the plenary #nlrc2016
Stephen Bottomley: if lawyers aren't doing law reform, we aren't doing our jobs #nlrc2016

In Aug '13 I saw the occupation of northern and north eastern SL by the Navy. There is no doubt torture+forced disappearances are continuing
Not to mention the factual issue: the Lankan armed forces are the potential persecutors. Transferring directly to them is indefensible
has been powerfully illustrated by @RACSaustralia here http://t.co/Wajp8UnNH5. Mockery of the huge time and expense of 'processing' centres
and of course, the most serious breach of human rights in Enhanced Screening: lack of legal representation and advice. The need for which >
articulate their claims precisely. Not to mention a lack of culturally appropriate interpreters and private, safe spaces for interviews >
Conducting enhanced screening at sea by or in the presence of military personnel means most asylum seekers would be too ill and scared to >
'Enhanced Screening' is precisely the opposite. It is cursory and deceptive. Only individuals who happen to use particular buzzwords pass.
Our govt is ordering the Navy to tow boats back through the Indian Ocean and transfer asylum seekers at sea to the Sri Lankan armed forces.
Frightening and sickening â€œ@Simon_Cullen: statement from Morrison on transfer of asylum seekers to Sri Lankan navy: http://t.co/yYbCU6fbdyâ€
@unicefaustralia There has been further violence, in the kidnapping and killing of Palestinians, will UNICEF Aus condemn this this as well?
